intro: Mollugophytum polycarpoides, commonly known as the mountain daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-forming leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils in mountainous regions. It has a compact growth habit and is often used in rock gardens due to its ornamental value. Mollugophytum polycarpoides is adapted to dry conditions and requires minimal water once established.
